Title: Henry V
Cast: Leslie Banks, Felix Aylmer, Robert Helpmann, Vernon Greeves, Gerald Case, Griffith Jones, Morland Graham, Nicholas Hannen, Michael Warre, Laurence Olivier, Ralph Truman, Ernest Thesiger, Frederick Cooper, Roy Emerton, Robert Newton
Plot: In the midst of the Hundred Years' War in 1415, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France. In the inspired Olivier concept, Shakespeare's play begins as a performance in the Globe Theatre, shifting in broad cinematic terms to an epic narrative of Henry V, who had developed from a dissolute youth to a purposeful monarch. Proving his ability as a soldier and skillful leader, he unites the dissident factions in the English army and goes on to crush the French, against enormous odds, at Agincourt. Arranging a treaty with the French court, he woos Princess Katharine to whom he is formally betrothed as part of the peace agreement. Written by alfiehitchie
Keywords: king, henry v, france, princess, globe theatre
Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 8 wins & 2 nominations.
Actors: Laurence Olivier, Robert Newton, Leslie Banks
Description: Directed by Laurence Olivier.  With Laurence Olivier, Robert Newton, Leslie Banks, Felix Aylmer. In the midst of the Hundred Years' War in 1415, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France.
